Description: Cast, copper alloy half of a curved ornamental terminal with a toothed, vegetal design, and a broken, pierced circle at one end for attachment. Traces of red colouring on the surface.
Curator's comments: Found in an unnumbered box of miscellaneous Masson collection ornaments and fragments, now designated 'Box 9'. C. Fabrègues: The design is stylistically close to that of an eagle from Egypt, dated 10th–12th century (Fehèrvāri 1980, p.54, no.47, pl.13a). Bibliography: Fehèrvāri, G. (1980) Islamic Metalwork of the Eighth to the Fifteenth Centuries in the Keir Collection, London.
Acquisition notes: Collected from the site of Begram, 1834-8 (MSS Eur. E161/VII, ff.31-3).
